comments.body:
I agree with this, but until then there are some simple solutions. Java of course though.

Maybe a mcfunction that clears the item out of everyones inventory. A command block would work too, but after a certain distance, it wouldn't work. So mcfunction is your best bet until Mojang actually adds filters.
Do a command block and make a ticking area for the chunks that they are in and it will be on 24/7 hope this helps

Yeah try typing this into a repeat and always active command block:

clear @a <item>

Change <item> to a item.

Like the idea tho!

You could set up a command block system, a repeating command block with the command:

clear @a itemid

You would also need to put the command clock in a ticking area, or make a ticking area for that command block.

There are a limited number of allowable ticks for each world/server. What is really needed is an option to remove items from players at an OP level. Something like remove Pistons and Sticky Pistons or shulker boxes from access to players. Pretty much any item. This way it stops all glitching by removing the ability for players to get a hold of certain items needed for duping.

Allow OPS to gray out any item in Minecraft. This should not be difficult at all to code in.

If a player doesn't like it let them leave, allow the rest to enjoy a cheat free environment albeit minus a few items

We can then make currency/trading systems, prevent griefers, etc...

Yes, after that there would be a setting to effect, visitor, member, or operator.
For example, I could select member and it would do member and below, but not operators.

This would most likely be up to 3rd party developers. Even the official Minecraft dedicated for Java doesn't have plugin support. From my understanding, Spigot and Bukkit etc. just build on top of the server software, they don't modify it themselves.
This post really needs way more upvotes. We NEED this. BDS server owners have to make due with the limitations of BDS or resort to using Nukkit or pocketmine, both of which have their own drawbacks.

I am an operator of BDS based server. In the process of building my server, we encountered many difficulties.
We hope to enable BDS to support plug-ins as soon as possible (preferably before January 15 next year), as well as developer friendly and powerful APIs. It is better to support JS, C + +, Python and even PHP to attract more developers to join. Due to the ecological defects of BSD and its lack of support for multi world, our work is extremely difficult. We favor the complete game features of BDS, but we are also discussing whether to switch to pmmp, which we don't want to see. So for developers like us and countless players, please support it as soon as possible! If we can reply to this suggestion within two weeks, we will insist on using BDS and create infinite brilliance in it.

When the To prohibit the Multiplayer Master, it infuriated me! But even more, they did not even bother to add this to Minecraft themselves !!! I really look forward to something similar from them in the next update ...
Isso seria ótimo!
I agree to this but not alot of people would want this, i just want to play survival withother players not just me alone its boring to play alone
Hi friends
that would fix  current lfg problem in minecraft discord
Simple and concise.
This would be really good.
But bedrock dosent run on mac os
Yes to this and to Bedrock on Mac. The Education Edition works on Mac, and it's based on the Bedrock Engine. I don't know why they haven't released a Mac version.
Great Idea bro i wish Mojang/Minecraft add Plugin File in Dedicated Server

Not just that, if you are falsely banned, you can't even appeal for the punishment which is just not right. Also letting featured servers ban people from their account is not smart. All (or at least most) of the staff/helpers/moderators are not paid and it is possible to abuse their power and completely ban people with out a reason or false ban them when they know they didn't break a rule. To solve this, the person who banned them should send evidence to Mojang/Minecraft and if they think it is good then they do their part and ban them from Xbox.
I agree if you're banned falsely and either way, you should still be able to play your own worlds offline.
I agree, remove the bar on hosting games and using marketplace content, Xbox players GET TO KEEP THEIR WORLDS
I think I lost all my rare maps and skins and it won’t tell me why even tho I didn’t cheat or say something bad :(
the thing is minecraft servers can do the work on banning players from the server so mojang doesnt have to so it doesnt make sense mojang PLEASE fix this
This is cool but I don't think this will ever happen.
I don't think this would be very useful because not everybody has Realms and all features should be accessible to everyone.
This is kinda impossible

I do not think this should be implemented for a multitude of reasons:

1: You can already join your friend's realm, just ask him to invite you, log out of your realm and log in his realm.

2: Easy cheating: if your friend's realm is in creative, but yours is in survival, you could get stuff obtained in creative and take that to your survival world.

BezaoBuilder,

who says I shouldn't be able to cheat in my own survival realm and play the way I want to?
I'm surprised this isn't even an option!

I am sick and tired of the idea of realms being not free. Servers on java are free(mostly), even if you make a server on bedrock people on X box have to pay to play. Why should people have to pay to play with there friends if they all have the game.
I voted I think so too

These new M1 chips are crazy powerful. And now that they share the same language as iOS apps (they can be run natively), you could theoretically run Minecraft bedrock OR Minecraft java on macOS. I would love to see a dedicated bedrock server come to macOS. Please make this happen!
Yes I agree! Struggling with the same issue. It’s impossible to find out who is causing problems if I can’t know who is signing in and when.
So should the dedicated server.  It shows timestamps for initial startup (which is mostly useless) but no more.
Dedicated bedrock server used to show timestamps for connecting and disconnected  players, but no longer does..... would be really useful to have that info again...
Yep

Absolutely love this idea!!! 

Also thanks for all you do Mojang :)
i need that
This can make a great gaming experience with my friends

In the short term, this would be good, as it would be great to be able to do this.

In the long term, giving more players access to non-featured servers is a bad idea, as featured servers will become less important, which will lower the quality of servers in general. Featured servers are large companies with big budgets to spend on making the best possible experience, while private servers are lower quality because of their budgets.

Also, console games are not allowed to share IPs of their users, so therefore they aren't allowed to connect to external servers.
No puedo jugar en linea

The reason its not allowed is money you can sugarcoat it all you want but pc mobile almost all other system beside console can add them. Your reason would only be vaildated if the dedicated servers were actually dedicated no functioal up to date servers exist. The dedication is non exsistant. They cant even be bothered to monitor the servers. They only care about the gamemodes that brings in money which is minigames and prison no other gamemodes actually worth it. Survival is non exsistant with no ability to craft mine or do anything in a small box world where ppl just trashtalk. Skyblocks are all the same claiming to update but never do. And lets b rea ppl have already done the ip stuff on pc and thats what made minecraft popular as almost everyone on minecraft wants this to be like java edition we all know the risks and know how to avoid it. They need something. Better then these fake dedicated servers

I hope we will be able to add private servers on Bedrock version for console. They just can put an option in the menu to unlock it if they want, but they should give us the possibility to connect directly to a private server on Bedrock consoles'.

With the parameters locked by default, only advanced user will unlock the access to private server so it will be good in long-term.

This is a big issue for dedicated Bedrock servers currently. There needs to be a streamlined method for doing this. Asking users to change their DNS settings to connect to an unofficial server to then connect to your server is asking too much. There should also be an option to /connect in the command bar.
I run my own private server and I found it really dumb that they went out of their way to disable this on consoles. Stop assuming ineptitude from your users.
I like this idea, but it should be toggleable if added. Ideally off by default. Servers should be able to choose whether or not to enable this anti-cheat stuff.
I can also see this being quite strenuous on a server. So yeah, definitely needs to be toggleable in the config.yml
Why not have it it only hide blocks that are greater than a few blocks away from visible blocks, as otherwise when mining you would expose the uncovered blocks before the server sends the true type

Hugh Williams,

To do that, they would have to fundamentally change the way servers send world data to players, and it would be too much work for something that is, as of now, a non-issue.
This message becomes very annoying when attempting to see server activity. Being able to turn it off would be a big QOL improvement.
now running server would appreciate this option as well
These could maybe be the most played servers, great idea!
But they would have to be officially approved by Mojang first.
Beautiful
I want to play Minecraft with my cousins
We started using shockbyte. id say its worth it
• ok so plugins wont work with how realms r made but mods can be and should be since you do pay for it
I definitely think adding mods to realms would make it a lot more fun because they allow you to explore with an unlimited amount of creativity!

Adding mods that allow you just to edit the vanilla base game rather than adding new blocks/other items would be useful as the /fill command is extremely limiting and does not allow for full creative enhancement like mods such as world edit and Axiom are able to do. Allowing simple mods should be at least the base of what we should be allowed to do on realm, as it is a paid subscription much like a server is.
yes minecraft please make the pleeeeeease
Invite them again?
Yeah, it could also be used for pranks, I like this idea
I think there is a section for "banned players" in a realm, and you can remove them from the list of "banned players".
Unblock them from the members section and you'll be fine
Can't go on bend me please

Can you unbend me please

Please
I just need this for real
There should be an option where a realm is either beta only, or stable only. You can't have a beta player playing on a stable realm.

Me and my friends would love to be able to pay for a realm but we cannot cause we cannot buy a realm subscription in the  Windows 10 beta version this should be part of the base game you are already playing a beta if its unstable that is on us for using the beta the realms should just be available. We have been waiting for that to be available since we joined the beta and it is still not available it is quite irritating having to leave a system on 24 hours a day just so we can play especially when we are willing to pay for  a realm.
Very good idea!
This is an option on Bedrock, so I think it should also be available on Java.
This, after all, can help fight "X-ray" and similar scams?
This has been added as of 1.17
literally what Im looking for.
Yes, Why Not....
Yea Mojang please
his doesn't make a lot of sense to me, I think private realms shouldn't be monitored and anarchy realm where hacking swearing and other things are totally allowed shouldn't  now be ruined

Swearing doesn't get you banned. Go here for a list of things that can get you banned.

Hacked client have always been agaist the Minecraft EULA and you should know it.

I agree that getting banned from singleplayer world is a bit exaggerate

Also, note, yes, hacking is banned, but if YOU are paying for the realm, you can do WHATEVER you want on it, you paid for it, And especially if the realm got made before this change, I feel like this should not be enforced on older realms, as they werent breaking the rules THEY AGREED TO.
Minecraft shouldn't have a moderation system at all. The players are able to deal with these things themselves.
Like just don't moderate, spend money on hiring "highly trained" moderators yet the community already has a mod out to stop your report feature from working. Just stop.
Llevo más de medio año jugando en mi servidor y siempre pienso en las limitaciones al ver terrerno, me gustaría que mejoraras eso

I like this idea. I usually only play with one other person on my realm and they don't even have a system capable of a high render distance. Me at least being able to go to 16 chunks when we're both on a TEN PERSON realm should be more than possible. I'd appreciate 24, even. 10 people normally would be 100 chunks rendered, and between the two of us it would only be 26 at most if the render distance was increased.
Why not Annually or am I not understanding this idea.

you made this sound a little uhhh. . . whats the word. kinda annoying i guess maybe entitled? i dont quite know

I fully agree with this.

10-20 dollars for a realm to last all time is hardly a good compromise. The 6 month subscription is more than that, let alone one that lasts forever. If you could buy a realm for all time, it would be something ridiculous, probably hundred(s) of dollars.

I just found out typing in "gamerule showcoordinates true" on the server console works without consequence to achievements--at least based on my experience. Bedrock Server 1.11.2.1 (Windows) running on Windows 10. I connect to the server on Windows 10 and Xbox One.
Do you mean in the chat window on bedrock. Or inside the server window where you start and stop the server?

Typing "gamerule showcoordinates true" did the trick! Thanks! 

(Be careful NOT to type a leading slash because this is not the same as a command)
Thank you very much!
